item.title: Issue #2237 created
item.description:
XSLT: impact of multiple schemas

There are several places where the impact of allowing multiple schemas in XSLT has not been fully explained.

3.15.1 explains that the in scope schema components for a region of the stylesheet depend on the [xsl:]schema-role attribute governing that region.

The statement in 3.15 that "If the role attribute is absent, the relevant schema components are available in all stylesheet modules within the [declaring package];" is inaccurate; they are only available in regions of the package not governed by an [xsl:]schema-role attribute.

This should also be explained in the part of 5.3.1 (static context) describing in-scope schema components, and in the description of the schema-aware attribute of xsl:evaluate.

Also note, test coverage of multiple schemas is currently very thin. For example, I think there are no tests for calling constructor functions for atomic types defined in imported schemas.
